<!--
1. On macOS and within Visual Studio, select Visual Studio > About Visual Studio, then click the Show Details button, then click the Copy Information button.

2. Paste below this comment block.

### Log File

<!--
1. On macOS and within Visual Studio:
    a. Click **Tools** > **SDK Command Prompt**.
    b. Within the launched `Terminal.app` window, run:

            adb logcat -d | pbcopy

2. Paste below this comment block

If I run the same code (android camera code) directly from Android Studio , everything works fine.But if I create a binding library in Visual Studio and then call the camera function from C# (Visual Studio) then I see the following warning messages and the camera is not capturing the image.Camera is stuck.But in a newer Android phone, it works fine.This issue is only observed in the older Android phone while using visual studio binding library.

Skipped XX frames! The application may be doing too much work on its main thread.

What could be the reason?How to fix it?

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened pull request "Revamp README.md to be single-page." (#1343) at xamarin/xamarin-android
Events.RelatedBody:
Refactors the `README.md` to be single-page and provide links for ways to directly contribute and provide feedback.

These items have been discussed as part of our community engagement efforts. 
 
https://github.com/xamarin/xamarin-macios has already implemented these changes as of last Friday.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Android.App.Dialog.DismissEvent Crashes when event is unsubscribed." (#1342) at xamarin/xamarin-android
Events.RelatedBody:
### Steps to Reproduce

1. Create an dialog (we experienced this issue using a AlertDialog)
2. Subscribe to the DismissEvent
3. Attempt to cleanup by unsubscribing from DissmissEvent
4. Exception occurs

<!--
If you have a repro project, you may drag & drop the .zip/etc. onto the issue editor to attach it.
-->

Event is successfully unsubscribed

### Actual Behavior
Exception is thrown

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Run the Xamarin.Android.Tools.AndroidSdk.dll unit tests" (#1341) at xamarin/xamarin-android
Events.RelatedBody:
The `Xamarin.Android.Tools.AndroidSdk.dll` unit tests in `Xamarin.Android.Tools.AndroidSdk-Tests.dll` aren't built or executed.

They should be.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened pull request "[msbuild][Mono.Android] add a bunch of "missing" manifest attributes." (#1338) at xamarin/xamarin-android
Events.RelatedBody:
This should fix https://github.com/xamarin/xamarin-android/issues/1224.

Those attributes were based on build-tools/manifest-attribute-codegen.exe
(which is not really codegen yet, but lists up all the manifest attributes
that are found from Android SDK resources).

However not all the attributes were documented. For those undocumented
attributes, the issue https://github.com/xamarin/xamarin-android/issues/1336
was created to track.

Events.RelatedDescription: Merged pull request "[Core, iOS, Android, UWP, WPF] Hide scroll view scroll bars" (#1910) at xamarin/Xamarin.Forms
Events.RelatedBody:
### Description of Change ###

Added vertical and horizontal scroll bar visibility properties to ScrollView and updated UWP, WPF, iOS and Android renderers

I noticed on Android when the ScrollView.Orientation = ScrollOrientation.Both that a horizontal scroll bar is never shown, only the vertical.  I did not try to change this to avoid making a default behavior change.

Unit Tests are not included as I'm not sure what to test right now besides that basic properties were set.

fixes #1670 

### Bugs Fixed ###

- N/A

### API Changes ###

Added:

```
 public enum ScrollBarVisibility
 {
	Default,
	Always,
	Never,
} 
```
 - ScrollBarVisibility ScrollView.HorizontalScrollBarVisibility {get; set;};
 - ScrollBarVisibility ScrollView.VerticalScrollBarVisibility {get;set;};

### Behavioral Changes ###

Describe any non-bug related behavioral changes that may change how users app behaves when upgrading to this version of the codebase.

### PR Checklist ###

- [ ] Has tests (if omitted, state reason in description)
- [x] Rebased on top of master at time of PR
- [x] Changes adhere to coding standard
- [x] Consolidate commits as makes sense

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "[Enhancement] Hide ScrollView scroll bars." (#1670) at xamarin/Xamarin.Forms
Events.RelatedBody:
## Rationale

Designers, in pursuit of their UX, may reasonably ask that the scroll bar be removed from a ScrollView.

see https://forums.xamarin.com/discussion/73353/how-to-hide-scroll-bar-in-scrollview
see https://stackoverflow.com/questions/9837003/how-to-hide-remove-the-scrollbar-in-uiscrollview-in-iphone

## Implementation

```csharp
public class ScrollView {
	public static readonly BindableProperty ShowVerticalScrollBar; // bool
	public static readonly BindableProperty ShowHorizontalScrollBar; // bool
}
```

## Expected Result

Hides vertical and/or horizontal scroll bar.

## Implications for CSS

None.

## Backward Compatibility

None. By default, properties are true.

## Difficulty : Easy

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "[Enhancement] More error information from XAMLC when missing OnPlatform tag" (#1978) at xamarin/Xamarin.Forms
Events.RelatedBody:
### Description

If I'm using the `OnPlatform` feature in XAML and forget the <OnPlatform> tag, the XAMLC error message is not very helpful in diagnosing the problem. For example if I do the following:

```
<ToolbarItem Clicked="OnItemAdded">
	<ToolbarItem.Text>
		<!--Forgot the OnPlatform tag-->
			<On Platform="Android,iOS" Value="+" />
			<On Platform="UWP" Value="Add" />
	</ToolbarItem.Text>
</ToolbarItem>
```

The error from XAMLC is just `Sequence contains no elements`. In XAMLG, the runtime error includes XmlLineInfo, which gives me a clue where to start looking for the problem.

### Steps to Reproduce

1. Create a ContentPage with `[XamlCompilation(XamlCompilationOptions.Compile)]`
2. In `<ContentPage.ToolbarItems>`, add the above XAML.
3.  Build.

### Expected Behavior

The line/character information provided by XAMLG when encountering this error. Even better if the error could provide the name of the file where the error occurs.

### Actual Behavior

`Sequence contains no elements`

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "[XI]LegacyXmlSettingsAreDisabled in XMLReaderSettings failed on iOS and tvOS device" (#3593) at xamarin/xamarin-macios
Events.RelatedBody:
### Steps to Reproduce

1. Update System to Xamarin.iOS d15-7 bcecd11d
2. Build and Execute System.Xml tests on iOS or tvOS device

### Expected Behavior
All tests should pass. 

### Actual Behavior
[FAIL] XmlReaderSettingsTests.LegacyXmlSettingsAreDisabled :   Expected: False

### Environment
mtouch 11.10.0.13 (d15-7: bcecd11d) . This issue was occurring  on mtouch 11.10.0.1 (d15-7: eadb8376) as well.

### Build Logs
http://xqa.blob.core.windows.net/gist/report-e67afa12d52d45ab8ae1b5d92312e3f6.txt
TestLog: http://xqa.blob.core.windows.net/gist/System.Xml-tvos10-29-1585652fd1ecb4eddd80ebefb1562b316473fa559b10-29-15-421768f5c5764af8bbd67b3d8f42781b.zip

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened pull request "[tests][macos] Fix AuthenticodeDeformatterTest.VerifySignedAssembly failure on modern. Fixes 3207" (#3603) at xamarin/xamarin-macios
Events.RelatedBody:
Modern does not, by default/design, ship a machine.config file. This
means it only knowns about the default crypto shipped with .NET.

That's a problem for MD2 for which some old certificates might still
exists in the computer store, like our wrench bots.

That's generally not a problem since XM apps delegate trust to macOS
except for one case: Authenticode.

So verifying an authenticode signature can end up, thru X509Chain,
loading a certificate using MD2 without knowing how to create the
digest algorithm - and fail.

The fix is to register the algorithm manually (if not found).

https://github.com/xamarin/xamarin-macios/issues/3207

Events.RelatedDescription: Merged pull request "Update README.md" (#3587) at xamarin/xamarin-macios
Events.RelatedBody:
New README layout which includes sections to help direct visitors to the appropriate areas.
Adds note about the license
